bibl.title: Letter from Patrick J. Hurley to Morris Sheppard, February 8, 1930

div1.p: Hurley confirms that Ames contracted yellow fever in Cuba, but reiterates that Ames did not take part in the actual experiments of the Yellow Fever Board.

div1.head: Letter from Patrick J. Hurley to Morris Sheppard, February 8, 1930
div1.opener:
From Mrs Ames
COPY
WAR DEPARTMENT
Washington
February 8, 1930
Honorable Morris Sheppard,
United States Senate.
Dear Senator Sheppard:
div1.p:
I have your letter of January 31, 1930,
relative to the record of service of Assistant Sur-
geon Roger P. Ames.

While the records furnish no evidence
that Dr. Ames took part in the actual experiments
conducted by the Yellow Fever Board in Cuba or that
he contributed in any way to the successful elucida-
tion of the problems worked out by that Board, they
do show that he contracted yellow fever, as did num-
erous other members of the Medical Department, in
the ordinary performance of his duty as a contract
surgeon and that as a result he was off duty from Jan-
uary 29 to February 5, 1901.

closer.signed:
Patrick J. Hurley (S)
Secretary of War
